notes.text: HMIs with this vulnerability can be compromised via local attack using removable USB storage devices to transfer malicious files. The executable files from a hard drive solidified by MACC (McAfee Application and Change Control) can be executed on the system that did not generate the inventory. CVE-2018-6690 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.1 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: McAfee has issued Security Bulletin SB10250 to address this vulnerability in MACC. SINAMICS PERFECT HARMONY GH180 Drives with HMIs produced between November 4, 2015 and October 9, 2018, use MACC as part of their software package, if option A30 was part of the order.
For compatibility reasons, Siemens advises the installation of MACC 8.2.0 instead of Version 8.0.0, hotfix 5 as mentioned in SB10250.
For the following products, Siemens recommends users upgrade to MACC v8.2.0 or greater using recommendations from McAfee to fix the vulnerability.
